extendedInfo.description: RawVision is the most complete solution for your photographic workflow, in between the camera and the computer.Transfer, organize, sort, rate, categorize, play, pixel-peep, edit, share to social networks RawVision lets you do all that and more in a ludic yet powerful way. You will not go to the computer anymore./!!! NEW: Rate and categorize your photos  to sidecar XMP !!!\\!!! Plug your camera with USB !!!/This application is especially intended for Android tablets, but it will work very well with smartphones too.Please try the demo version before purchasing the app, to ensure your file format and connectivity is supported.Don't hesitate to contact us directly if you need supportFollow RawVision on G+ https://plus.google.com/b/115688227829924074471/115688227829924074471/postsFeatures- RawVision supports Nikon NEF, Canon .CR2 , SONY .ARW, Pentax .PEF and .DNG and Samsung .SRW files, Olympus .ORF, Panasonic RW2, Fujifilm's .RAF.- opens only thumbnails for Leica M DNG and Nikon D100 Nef files- JPEG and PNG- preview of .MOV files(Android>3.0)- Transfer from: camera usb connection(MTP/PTP), usb external reader, Eye-Fi and advanced local browsing - Bookmark your favorite locations- Gallery display. Select a file with a click. To perform batch actions, select all the files and press the action button on the bottom-right of the screen.- Select a rating and category in full Ssreen to help sort photos. Import to LightRoom with the XMP sidecar files.You can also define your own category labels.- FullScreen viewYou can browse all the photos by sweeping the screen right or left. There are invisible areas on the left and right to quickly change photo.Zoom on photos with a pinch.Delete a photo right awaystart a slideshowCheck the histogram and ExifsToggle the actions bar with a single tap, double tap to have the photo fit to screen- Image editorEdit and process your photos with the embbeded editor.Compatible with Aviary filters.- Import FilesYou can import selected files by choosing a root folder, then a name for the new import folder - or the current date. You can also choose to rename the files and delete them after import.Import also works directly from your camera via USB.- Delete filesYou can delete files either one a time or several in a batch by selecting them before.- JPEG extractionExtract a JPEG preview of the RAW files with resize and auto-rotate options.You can extract several files in a batch.- Share Files - "Open with...""Share" your files with other apps on your Android device.Sketch an extracted preview, launch a video file, share by facebook, twitter, send by email, store on dropbox etc... - Rename files- Eye-Fi supportEye-Fi needs a little configuration.You should be able to use AP mode if you registered your device wihtin the card.(With the official app for example) - but Not tested yetOtherwise the direct mode works great.First connect the device to the WiFi AP (Ey-fi card in direct mode) with the wpa2 key in the Eye-Fi Center desktop app.Then in RawVision, enter the uploadKey - please google how to get it.Choose the destination folder and start the service.Photos will then appear as they are sent from the camera.Note: you cannot use Eye-Fi service while another eyefi app is running. Is your RAW format not supported: send us samples to http://www.dropitto.me/dropyourraw (pwd: raw)/!\ Please taken a few seconds to rate the application on the Android Market./!\ Don't hesitate to send comments by email, feedback is very important to improve the application's quality./!\ If you have question, send an email as it is not possible to reply in the comments.

reviews.title: Handy tool to have!
reviews.comment: On a recent holiday, I took a tablet and this app, instead of my laptop and Lightroom. For cranking out a quick jpeg with a few adjustments, this was great. My only criticism (author, please advise if I missed something here) is that my Sony\'s raw files could not be extracted to a full resolution jpeg... even setting the extract option to zero which supposedly meant a full size jpeg would be created, did not do so. Largest jpeg I could get was 1080 px. But given that I just wanted jpegs to send to social media, this wasn\'t a deal breaker. For others, it might be. Ymmv. In all, really happy with raw vision. Thanks.
reviews.author: Bruce Williams

reviews.title: It\'s not for mobile life
reviews.comment: I can\'t choose a specific raw photo directly from camera, and share it to Instagram. Quite simple scenario, but no way to do. I\'m using Canon 5D MKII and Galaxy S4. It\'s either problem with interface on small screens, or absence of functionality.
reviews.author: Andrey Yurin

reviews.title: Great app but...
reviews.comment: Hello developers, I am having problems using my purchased effects in aviary. I am getting errors all the time. :-$
reviews.author: Charbel Saad

reviews.title: Mature Product for Digital Photography
reviews.comment: I have been using RawVision for almost a year and it has evolved into a powerful, mature product that I rely on to work with my Nikon RAW (.NEF) images.  It\'s fast, reliable, and on those rare occasions I\'ve needed it, support has been prompt and helpful.
reviews.author: Bill Jastrow

reviews.title: Excellent - now a permanent part of my workflow!
reviews.comment: A very usable browser and organiser for your images. Auto advance makes rating and sorting images a breeze! Top marks! Any chance of adding file operations in,  move, copy etc.?
reviews.author: Graham Hilling

reviews.title: Well is fixed
reviews.comment: It was a error when updating the app. I had to install again, but thanks to Emmanuel for the help 5 stars
reviews.author: Balderas Jose

reviews.title: Works GREAT!
reviews.comment: Reads my Nikon D5000 RAW .NEF files flawlessly. The developer is extremely quick to reply to any suggestions. Highly recommend anything Caketuzz does. I also use it with the Eye-Fi and it works great as well, allowing me to automagically transfer and view my photos on my Nexus 7 in just a few seconds.
reviews.author: Brian Thompson

reviews.title: DNG Files not rendering properly on Nexus 7
reviews.comment: Seems the best app I can find, but I can\'t get DNG files from a Leica M9 camera to render properly. JPEGs are no problem. Help!
reviews.author: Rapierwitman

reviews.title: Awesome App
reviews.comment: I\'ve tried all the raw photo editing apps and this one is by far the best. The transition time between images is amazing and everything is intuitive and easy to use. Great job!
reviews.author: Mike Lesnick

reviews.title: Very cool
reviews.comment: Two issues: 1) why is RAWVision in every share dialog? Should it only allow sharing for images?  2) I have RAW files on an external microSD card but I can\'t find a way to open them with the app
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good but has sharing issue
reviews.comment: I can view pics with most devices on the go now but every share menu is spammed by your app, it\'s messy.
reviews.author: Phil Diamond

reviews.title: Impressive
reviews.comment: The app does a lot more than I need. With the parts I do use, I\'ve not had a single problem yet. Support is helpful and quick to respond. Latest improvements (e.g. text size) make it a perfect Raw solution on my Nexus 10.
reviews.author: Alto Speckhardt

reviews.comment: Works as advertised. I tried someother programs, but they did not work well on Galaxy Tab 2.
reviews.author: HARVEY MANDELL

reviews.title: Nexus 10 navigation difficult
reviews.comment: A great programme which should be even better on the high resolution nexus 10 screen. Unfortunately it hasn\'t been optimised for this so the text is very small which makes navigation nearly impossible
reviews.author: Andy Mann

reviews.title: Fabulous on Asus TF301
reviews.comment: Love the Favorites feature.  This is perfect for direct access to the directory w/ the images instead of navigating your way to it each time.  For example:  /storage/sdcard2/DCIM/100CANON
reviews.author: Glenn Greenfield

reviews.title: Great app, works perfectly on Asus TF700T
reviews.comment: After last update the pictures can be rated while reviewing. The editor editor now saves 2048 jpg of the edited raw file. Writes an xmp file to the raw file which holds the info for the rating and label - raw droid, however rates the images without additional files.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: So far so good
reviews.comment: Played with it on a Nexus 10 and it seems like it could come in handy to rate the files and import into Lightroom 4.  I initially had issues with Lightroom 4 reading the XMPs but it turned out to be a Lightroom issue, so this is looking good so far.
reviews.author: Ivan Krolo

reviews.title: Nice app for both studio and field, good support.
reviews.comment: I use this app with a Nexus 7 4G, hooked up straight to my Canon 5D or 5D MkII. In the studio, it means I don\'t have to pull the CF card and go to my computer; in the field, I don\'t need to bring a laptop to view my images at a decent image size. Tech support is awesome; I\'ve never waited longer than a day for an answer.
reviews.author: Robert Behal

reviews.title: Best of it\'s class, but still needs \"polish\"
reviews.comment: I tried all the RAW photo viewers that I could find in the Android market, and finally purchased this one as the best of the bunch. I\'m happy with my purchase, especially at the price charged, but I\'d like to see the app improved further, particularly in terms of polishing the user interface. The app offers all the features I\'m looking for, but the UI feels a little clunky, and sometimes confusing, and could probably stand to have better aesthetics.
reviews.author: Steve Long

reviews.title: Excellent app for RAW image users
reviews.comment: Great app if you want to view, edit or process RAW files on your tablet or even large-screen phone. An extra star to the developer for taking a suggestion from me and incorporating in a new version of the app less than 48 hours later!
reviews.author: Ewan Clydesdale
